column1: 01:20|one twenty|I woke up and glanced at my watch on the table next to my bed. It was one twenty. My heart was beating furiously. I slid off the bed down onto the carpet
column3: and took some deep breaths. Then I held my breath
column6: and tried to focus. I must have swum too much
column8: or got too much sun.|Blind Willow

column2: looking like a minor female prophet about to curse the sins of the people. ""May I trespass on your valuable time long enough to ask what in the name of everything bloodsome you think you're playing at
column3: young piefaced Bertie? It is now some twenty minutes past one o'clock in the morning
column4: and not a spot of action on your part."""|Jeeves and the Feudal Spirit|P.G. Wodehouse

column2: but I hadn't heard Father come upstairs to bed. I wondered if he was asleep downstairs or whether he was waiting to come in and kill me. So I got out my Swiss Army Knife and opened the saw blade so that I could defend myself.|The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time|Mark Haddon
